issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Improve the log when FinishAppEvent sent to the NodeManager which didn't run the application

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
once we restart nodemanager we see many logs like :
2015-12-28 11:59:18,725 WARN org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.nodemanager.containermanager.ContainerManagerImpl: Event EventType: FINISH_APPLICATION sent to absent application application_1446103803043_9892

we find that the app containers are never started on NM and is released by AM after allocated.
fields.summary: FinishAppEvent is leaked in leveldb if no app's container running on this node

one other thing could be done is that RM may not need to send finished app info in the first place. but that's bigger change. 

committing this.
Committed to trunk, branch-2, branch-2.8 thanks [~sandflee] !

FAILURE: Integrated in Hadoop-trunk-Commit #9181 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/9181/])
YARN-4520. Finished app info is unnecessarily persisted in NM (jianhe: rev 992dd2f783fc051c32727d4a45a5c61c22bf5640)
* hadoop-yarn-project/CHANGES.txt
* hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/yarn/server/nodemanager/containermanager/ContainerManagerImpl.java
